items.sentence: Tom flipped over the card and saw that it was the ace of spades.
Tom had a hunch that Mary had spent the day reading comic books.
Tom wants to graduate from college before he turns 24 years old.
Tom was blinded by the sunlight when he stepped out of the cave.
Tom was lucky to have a teacher who was a native French speaker.
Tom wondered how Mary could be so sure that she\'d win the race.
I don\'t know why Tom didn\'t come and I don\'t want to ask him.
Tom wondered if Mary had also heard the same rumors he\'d heard.
Tom told Mary that it was too cold to go outside without a coat.
If Tom had been here, it definitely would\'ve made a difference.
I think it\'ll taste better if you add a little salt and pepper.
Tom says that he and Mary have played chess together many times.
Tom should go to bed early tonight since he has a test tomorrow.
Tom stood alone under a big clock in the deserted train station.
Tom only allowed Mary to watch three hours of television a week.
Tom told me that he wanted to buy his mother a pair of slippers.
Tom took a piece of candy, unwrapped it and put it in his mouth.
Tom didn\'t believe that Mary was capable of doing such a thing.
We\'ll have to wait and see whether Tom will be able to do that.
There wasn\'t enough time to do everything that we needed to do.
